newsitem.title: USA: Surety Capital sets shareholder rights plan.
newsitem.headline: Surety Capital sets shareholder rights plan.

text.p: Surety Capital Corp established a shareholder rights plan to ensure fair treatment of its shareholders if there is a takeover bid for the company.

The rights plan, which goes into effect after a person or group buys 15 percent or more of the company's common stock or makes a tender offer for that amount, is not in response to any specific effort to acquire the company, Surety Capital said in a statement on Wednesday.
Surety Capital will issue one common stock purchase right for each share to shareholders of record at the close of business on June 6, 1997, the company said.
